entry.title: Re: How to avoid partials supplies
entry.content:
Below are some approaches you can explore

Enable batch management for cable materials. Maintain batch characteristics like:

  • Available length per reel
  • Shielding type
  • Wire section

During PR or reservation, use batch selection criteria to ensure only batches with sufficient length are considered. This ensures that only batches with ≥ required length (e.g., 20m) are proposed.

Treat each reel as a serial number or equipment. Maintain the actual length in the serial/equipment master. During picking or goods issue, validate that the selected reel meets the full requirement. This avoids combining multiple reels unless explicitly allowed.

Implement a custom enhancement in MRP or reservation logic. Check available stock for full-length pieces. If not available, trigger external procurement for full length. Prevent partial picking from warehouse. This requires ABAP development but gives full control.

entry.title: Re: How to check the breakup of the Planned value of Good...
entry.content:
Use transaction CO03, go to the Components Overview tab, Check material numbers, Quantities, Planned values (based on BOM and routing) and Valuation type and price control (Standard/Moving Average). This shows what SAP planned to issue and at what value.

Use transaction MB51 or COGI, filter by Movement type 261, your production order number. Review Actual quantity issued and Actual value posted. This helps identify what was actually issued and at what cost.

Use Report S_ALR_87013019 – Order Report. This report provides a detailed comparison of Planned vs actual quantities, Planned vs actual values and Component-level breakdown

entry.title: Re: 'Modify' stmt showing sy-subrc = 0 for duplicate record
entry.content:
I have few new remarks after reading again your initial question, and your extended question in the comment.

  1. Q1: modify dbtab returns sy-subrc = 0 but you say it's not updating.
  2. Q2: you want to know which lines are not updated if MODIFY dbtab returns sy-subrc = 4.

Concerning Q1, it's not possible that one line is "not updated" but sy-subrc = 0, so check twice, but if it's confirmed, it's a critical failure so contact the SAP support first, then your database vendor. It's more likely that the concerned line appears twice or more in your internal table, and the last one applies (NB: which one is the "last one" is not documented in the ABAP documentation). To avoid this kind of issue, use an internal table with a unique key corresponding to the database table and make sure to not short dump your program by attempting to insert a duplicate key in the internal table. Another reason could be that the program does additional updates or rollbacks or whatever.

Concerning Q2, there's no reason to write some additional code to find the lines which could not be inserted if sy-subrc = 4 and the database table has no secondary unique index. This case won't happen. If it happens that a secondary unique index exists, the solution is to rollback and fail the program, to remove the secondary unique index or make it not unique, not to find the lines which have not been inserted. Note that in case your database table has a secondary unique index, you should not use "MODIFY dbtab FROM TABLE itab" but instead use either UPDATE dbtab FROM TABLE itab followed by INSERT dbtab FROM TABLE itab or use LOOP AT itab INTO wa followed by MODIFY dbtab FROM wa, as explained in the ABAP documentation: https://help.sap.com/doc/abapdocu_latest_index_htm/latest/en-US/index.htm?file=abapmodify_source.htm#!ABAP_ALTERNATIVE_2@2@. If you really want to know the duplicates, go to the solution of LOOP AT itab INTO wa followed by MODIFY dbtab FROM wa.

entry.title: How to make certain fields appear only on the second-to-last page in Adobe form?
entry.content:
Hi All,

   Now I am working on development of an Adobe form. there are two master pages,  master page1 is used to output sales order data, and the master page2 is only output some text. If there is a large amount of items data, the master page1 will output multiple times, but the master page2 will only output once. 

    There is a field named "total amount" in master page1(not in design view),    this field should be output only in last page of mater page1,  I try to use below JS to control the output ,but it doesn't work. It does not display on any of the pages.

var totalPages = xfa.layout.pageCount();
var currentPage = xfa.layout.absPage(this);

if (currentPage == (totalPages - 1)) {
    this.presence = "visible";
} else {
    this.presence = "hidden";
}

but if I swap the positions of these two control statements, like below code , this field will output on all mater page1.

var totalPages = xfa.layout.pageCount();
var currentPage = xfa.layout.absPage(this);

if (currentPage == (totalPages - 1)) {
    this.presence = "hidden";
} else {
    this.presence = "visible";   
}

 Could anyone please tell me how to implement this function? Thank you.

entry.title: Notification in SVT when registration data is not maintained
entry.content:
Hello All,

We have a scenario where we don't have Registration for Substances maintained in Property Tree. In this case., we want to send a notification to Stakeholders on the first order for any Material containing this substance. And once Registration data is maintained, then only send notification after 70% of Threshold (for example) or falling back on the Standard configuration for Reactions in SAP SVT Classic. 

One option that we looked at was to maintain Information Threshold to 1% or very low so that notification is sent, but then it will send notification all the time, for more substances then we intend to. And second option was to have a report from SAP for this.

I would like to check anyone has come across this scenario and managed it some other way which could be a better fit.

entry.title: Re: How to Pack Cartons onto Pallet automatically in SAP...
entry.content:
Dear @Lakshmi_Priya96 ,

you can find the relevant information in the SAP Help Portal here:

Automatic Packing – Packing with Packing Instructions 

In your case we are talking about Nested Handling Units for which you need to create Multi-Level Packing Instructions.

In your particular case, you need to create a packing instruction for the carton which should contain the packaging material and the item which should be packed.

In addition to that, you need to create a second packing instruction, which contains the pallet as packaging material and the subordinate packing instruction of the carton packing instruction you created in the first place.

As a next step you need to create the determination record for the determination type.

 

best regards,

Marius

entry.title: Re: Replicate by Replication Model App in SAP Cloud ERP
entry.content:
Hello @F_Coutinho 

Thank you for your question and the detailed screenshots.

Have a look at these links Maintain Business Roles Within the SAP S/4HANA Cloud, How to Create and Assign Spaces and Pages & Replicate by Replication Model for details.

The issue you face often happens when you manually add catalog to your copied role without correct launchpad assignments. This means the app tile will not appear even if the catalog technically contains the app. This is why after you recreated the role from the standard template, the system automatically brought in the correct catalog and mappings, hence enabling the app to become visible.

The best practice in public cloud is to:

  • Always start by copying the delivered SAP_BR_CONF_EXPERT_BUS_NET_INT template.
  • If you need to extend access, add additional catalogs or registrations but do not remove the default pages or space.
  • Ensure you assign the role to the user if necessary.
  • Finally, log out and back in or refresh the Fiori launchpad cache.

I hope this provides the desired insight. Happy to answer any further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Thanks for attending SAP Tech Night at SAP Labs Gurgaon – A Night of Ideas, Inspiration & Community
entry.content:
SAP Tech Night at SAP Labs Gurgaon – A Night of Ideas, Inspiration & Community 🌙💡

Yesterday, we had the privilege of hosting  SAP Community Tech Night at SAP Labs Gurgaon, and what an incredible evening it turned out to be! 

The Flow of the Evening 🌟

✨ A Warm Beginning

The evening began with my welcome to everyone and a brief sharing of the agenda, followed by Jitan Batra and Neeraj Manocha, who painted a vivid picture of the SAP Community journey—from Stammtisch and Tech Nights to Inside Tracks. Their words reminded us that behind every great community lies the spirit of people coming together, sharing, and growing.

⚡ The Future with SAP Joule
I had the opportunity to present SAP Joule—exploring its role for developers, consultants, studios, skills, automation, and agents. What struck me most wasn’t just delivering the session—it was the spark in the room, the curiosity, and the conversations that followed. The future of work with Joule feels closer than ever.

🤖 AI Transforming Support
Nirjar Gandhi then took us on a journey into AI-driven customer support, showcasing tools like Early Watch, Application Conversion Assistant, App Inspector in S/4HANA 2025, and Intelligent Log Analysis. It was one of those sessions that made us realize—AI isn’t a buzzword here, it’s solving real problems today.

🌍 Rise with SAP
Closing the formal sessions, Niharika Razdan spoke about Rise with SAP and how it’s reshaping ERP. Her perspective on the role of SAP Basis consultants sparked important discussions about career growth, transformation, and the opportunities ahead.

🤝 Networking & Next Steps
The networking session was buzzing—people exchanging ideas, making plans, and brainstorming about the upcoming SAP Inside Track Gurgaon on 15-Nov-2025. It was community in action, and it felt powerful.

🍴 Dinner Together
Finally, over dinner, conversations flowed as naturally as the food. Because at the heart of every great community event is not just learning together, but also sharing a meal and building friendships.

Gratitude 🙏

  • To the speakers for making the sessions insightful and inspiring.

  • To the attendees from across SAP, IBM, TCS, Accenture, Capgemini, The Silicon Partner, and more – for bringing your passion and energy.

  • To SAP Labs Gurgaon – for hosting us so warmly.

  • To everyone who supported and organized behind the scenes – you made it all possible.

What’s Next? 🚀

The excitement doesn’t end here. With discussions already underway for the SAP Inside Track Gurgaon, we’re just getting started.

Last night reminded me of this truth: Technology changes fast, but it’s the people, the community, and the shared learning that make the biggest difference. And that’s what SAP Community is all about.

👉 Were you part of SAP Tech Night? Share your favorite highlight or takeaway in the comments—I’d love to hear your perspective!

On behalf of SAP Community NCR

entry.title: Re: How to create ODATA v4 POST API where it will take in...
entry.content:
Hello @OmkarVB, you can set up a function import to be called either using a GET or a POST HTTP request, so to answer your question, yes you can pass your structure or parameters in the body of the POST request you just need to specify the type of request in the table if function import in SEGW

Note: Passing the parameters in the request body only work if you are using OData V4.

You can reference from SAP Help here: https://help.sap.com/docs/ABAP_PLATFORM_NEW/68bf513362174d54b58cddec28794093/c5dc22512c312314e10000000a44176d.html

entry.title: Re: Notification in SVT when registration data is not mai...
entry.content:
Hello

you need to be more precise. SVT support two legal demands.

One there the relevant object has a "registriation limit" (e.g  REACH like registrations); and one for this is not the case (most of the other "non Reach like" reglations)

in the SVT set up: there is (in most of the case) not"good practical" set up possisble if you stick to SAP Standard to generate the mail ( i need to skip details)

Regarding your story: for me it is not clear: Do we talk about a "REACH" like regulation or something different

Anyhow: as mentioned: if you stick to SAP standard: you will get "many notifications" by day if the same material under some conditions ins in scope. 

MOst of the people (in know) are very unhappy with this kind of set up

E.g. as references:

https://community.sap.com/t5/product-lifecycle-management-q-a/svt-standard-emails-are-not-generating-even-though-volume-is-tracked-and/qaq-p/12781781

https://community.sap.com/t5/product-lifecycle-management-q-a/svt-monitoring-emails-were-not-generating/qaq-p/479173

https://community.sap.com/t5/product-lifecycle-management-q-a/svt-check-in-ehs/qaq-p/10147268

And may be more.

Wish best wishes

C.B.

PS it is not a good idea to use the eMail option if more than 10% of data is missing. Limitations are as: You can specify only one email address; the eMail content "looks not so niece" etc.

entry.title: All the partners are not copied into billing document item from sales order item
entry.content:
Hi All,

Have maintained copy controls from Sales order to Billing properly, 

let say in Sales order item , we have 10 partners but when we have created billing document then at billing item level only 5 partner's are copied ( App : Manage Billing Document ) and saved it. But if i open the same billing document of GUI app then i can see all the billing item partners.  

Upon analysis understood that in public cloud - if the billing partner header and item partner are same then those partners are not copied at item level only the unique partners are copied at billing document item level.

Can any one please confirm is this the expected behaviour or is there any config where all the sales order item partners can be copied to billing item partners.

Thanks a lot

entry.title: Re: ODATA call to RODPS_REPL_ODP_GET_DETAL for std CDS view gets cs_sy_move_cast_error
entry.content:
@Janet2- You can check ST22, where you should find runtime error logs. This will help you determine where and why you are getting the error.

There are two possibilities besides that.

  1. Either Synapse Analytics sends an unacceptable value for a field or fields, so the ST22 runtime error can provide a clue.
  2. Since it's related to the standard object IFIGLACCTLIR$F (ACDOCA) and RODP_REPL_ODP_GET_DETAIL, there might be an issue. Therefore, search SAP Notes and Knowledge Base Articles (KBAs) on SAP Support; there might be an SAP Note to fix the issue.

Good luck!

Thanks,
Tuncay

Why, if I find it, would this particular field be in a random country table on its own? Makes no sense to me.

Thanks in advanced.

entry.title: Re: How to distinguish the Valuation Class of T stock and...
entry.content:
Hello @jason_su 

Thank you for your question.

Yes, you are right that in On-Premise conflicts between POD and MTO regarding the valuation class can be solved using the BAdI you mentioned. In Public Cloud however, that BAdI is not available because classic enhancement spots are restricted. Instead, you have alternative mechanisms to control valuation class assignment without custom coding

The Public Cloud offers you better solution such as:

  • Split your Valuation through valuation category
  • The option to carry out your valuation class through account determination groups
  • Ability to extend based on event through In-App Extensibility

If you decide to use the public cloud, I recommend to:

First, try to solve it with the Split Valuation or Account Determination Group. This case is configuration driven and it adheres to the clean-core approach.

Check if there is an exposed In-App BAdI in the custom fields and logic app. This, only if your requirement cannot be mapped with standard options.

Consult Split Valuation, Extensibility for Account Determination & Custom Business Objects, Fields, and Logic for more details.

I hope this provides the desired insight. Happy to answer any further questions.

Best regards

Chris

A simple internal table like this :

1000         A1        B2

1000         A2        B2

How to achieve this using SAP ABAP 7.5 ?

Tks.

entry.title: Re: BP tab not enabled
entry.content:
Possible root causes for Organization tab not enabled in BP are

  • The business partner role (e.g., FLVN00, FLVN01, FLCU00, FLCU01) might not be assigned correctly.
  • You may have selected a business partner type (e.g., person or group) that doesn’t support organizational data.
  • Customizing in transaction BUPT or SPRO might not have enabled the organization tab for the selected role.

Then, for the other issue Reconciliation Account not connected to Company Code, the possible root causes are

  • The BP may not be extended to the company code in the customer role.
  • The account may not exist or be valid for the selected company code.
  • The company code view might be missing or not saved properly.

To fix both the above issues, go to BP, create or change BP with type Organization, assign role FLCU01 (Customer - Company Code), Ensure the Organization tab appears; if not, check role config in BUPT. In the Company Code tab assign your Company Code, enter a valid Reconciliation Account (check in FS00). Save and validate.

entry.title: Document types & Warehouse processing type determination in EWM - Blog 2
entry.content:
Intro:
This is not new but would be clarify some doubts for someone that how the document types and warehouse processing types will be determined in EWM.
Main part:
Let see more on how the documents will be choosen and how the inbound document types and categories will be mapped between the ERP and EWM.
Inbound in ERP VL31N - Document type - EL & Item Category - ELN


Inbound in EWM /n/SCWM/MON -
Doc Category PDI, Document type INB
Item category DLV, Item type IDLV.

Document type mapping in ERP
Here the ERP vs EWM inbound document header types has been mapped
SIMG - SCM EWM - EWM - Interfaces - ERP Integration - Delivery Processing - Map Document Types from ERP System to EWM

Map Item Types from ERP System to EWM
Here ERP vs EWM document item types has been mapped.
SIMG - SCM EWM - EWM - Interfaces - ERP Integration - Delivery Processing - Map Item Types from ERP System to EWM

Define Document Types for Inbound Delivery Process
Here the profiles against document type has been configured.
SIMG - SCM EWM - EWM - Goods Receipt Process - Inbound Delivery - Define Document Types for Inbound Delivery Process.

Define Item Types for Inbound Delivery Process
Here the profiles for item types has been configured only for the inbound deliveries.
SIMG - SCM EWM - EWM - Goods Receipt Process - Inbound Delivery - Define Item Types for Inbound Delivery Process

The profiles in EWM will choosen as below as per above configs made for INB document type.
Define Status Profiles
Here we can configure the status for each profiles.
SIMG - SCM EWM - EWM - Cross Process Settings - Delivery Warehouse Request - Status Management - Define Status Profiles

Similarly partner profiles will be maintained here.
SIMG - SCM EWM - EWM - Cross Process Settings - Delivery Warehouse Request - Partner Processing - Define Partner Profiles

Define Document Type Determination for Inbound Delivery Process
Here the document types for Inbound process has been maintained.
SIMG - SCM EWM - EWM - Goods Receipt Process - Inbound Delivery - Define Document Type Determination for Inbound Delivery Process.

Here you can see the warehouse processing type has been choosen as 1010. Let see how this has been choosen here


Defining the Warehouse process type.
SIMG - SCM EWM - EWM - Cross-Process Settings - Warehouse Task - Define Warehouse Process Type


Determine Warehouse Process Type
Using this configuration we can define which WPT to be picked for which documents.
SIMG - SCM EWM - EWM - Cross-Process Settings - Warehouse Task - Determine Warehouse Process Type
By above configuration system found the WPT to be picked as 1010 for the document type INB.
Now lets see on what ways we can pick the warehouse processing type.
1. Document Type
2. Item Type
3. Delivery Priority
4. Process Type Determination Indicator
Control Indicators for WPT determination
SIMG - SCM EWM - EWM - Cross-Process Settings - Warehouse Task - Define Control Indicators for Determining Warehouse Process Types


Later maintain the control indicator to the determination of warehouse process type again with PTDI.
SIMG - SCM EWM - EWM - Cross-Process Settings - Warehouse Task - Determine Warehouse Process Type
Maintain the same in /n/scwm/mat01
After this create a inbound delivery in ERP and in EWM the warehouse process order type will be picked as per the configuration.


Conclusion:
Hope this may help some one on understanding the Document mapping in EWM. Took reference from Sunils Udemy course.

entry.title: Re: F110 Printout Error / GL account is not defined
entry.content:
Some of the root causes are

  • The error “G/L Account is not defined in Chart of Accounts” (Message F5507) means the system is trying to post or reference a G/L account that does not exist in the operating chart of accounts assigned to your company code. Even if the account exists at company code level (SKB1), it must also exist at chart of accounts level (SKA1).
  • During print execution, SAP may call additional accounts (e.g., bank clearing, cash discount, exchange difference, charges). If any of these are not properly defined in FBZP → Bank Determination → Accounts or in the payment medium program configuration, the system will throw this error.
  • Check that the House Bank and Account ID used in the payment run are linked to the correct G/L account in FI12. If the G/L account assigned here doesn’t exist in the chart of accounts, the print step will fail.
  • For check printing, the system may require a check lot account or reference to a G/L account that hasn’t been created in the chart of accounts.

To fix this, go to fs00, select that G/L Account which throws the error message and ensure, it exists both in Chart of Accounts and Company Code levels. Go to fbzp and confirm the correct Bank Clearing Account is assigned for the payment method, house bank, and account ID. If using check printing, review FCHI (Check Lots) and ensure the account is valid. Double-check OBY6 (Company Code → Chart of Accounts assignment) to confirm the right chart of accounts is linked.

entry.title: Re: Inconsistent Sales Order Costing Behavior for Configu...
entry.content:
• If the requirements type → requirements class → costing variant assignment is not identical across plants, you’ll see different results.
  • If the valuation variant, costing sheet, or transfer control differs by plant, the costing variant determination will behave differently.
  • If master data (BOMs/routings) or valuation area settings differ, the costing results will diverge even if the strategy group is the same.

entry.title: Re: No control parameter entries found for document
entry.content:
Your post is not complete to understand the issue. Please answer the following:

  • What is the full error message (it should specify order type, plant, and controlling area)?
  • Which order type is being used for the process order?
  • Which plant and controlling area are involved?
  • Has the order type–plant–controlling area combination been configured in OPL8?
  • Is this issue happening for all process orders in that plant, or only for specific ones?
  • Was there any recent transport or config change (e.g., new plant, new order type, or controlling area assignment)?

entry.title: Re: in which table OMRDC configuration is stored?
entry.content:
The configuration you maintain in transaction OMRDC is stored in the following tables:

  • T169P → This is the primary table where the duplicate invoice check settings are stored.
  • T001 → Company code data is also relevant, since the duplicate check is defined at company code level.

So when you configure OMRDC, the system writes the entries into T169P, linked to the company code from T001.

entry.title: Re: How the cost estimation will happen in Campaign orders
entry.content:
In standard SAP, only one production version can be flagged as relevant for standard cost estimate (the “costing” indicator in the production version). The standard cost estimate is calculated for the material using that one version (typically the “normal production” version). Other production versions (e.g., cleanout) are not included in the standard cost estimate unless you explicitly choose them in a simulation or alternative cost estimate.

What happens in your case is if you use this for standard costing, the standard cost will include both production and cleanout activities/materials. This gives you a “full cost per batch” view, but it may not reflect how you actually execute orders. If the production version is used for costing, the standard cost will cover only the production portion and exclude cleanout costs. Cleanout version cannot be separately costed into the standard cost of the main material. When you run cleanout orders, their actual costs will post, but since there is no standard cost estimate for them, they will appear as variances when settled.

entry.title: Re: Curriculum Requirements with Retraining
entry.content:
Hi

This requirement goes beyond standard curriculum retraining in SAP SuccessFactors Learning — the default “period-based requirement” only resets the due dates, but it still allows repeated courses to count if they are in the pool.

Why this is tricky in SF Learning

LMS does not have an out-of-the-box rule “don’t count courses you already completed in a prior period.
If the same Item ID and Version is assigned again in the next requirement period, and the completion is still valid, it will count again—or if re-taken, it will show as completed and contribute toward the hours.
Therefore: to force learners to take different courses each year, you must break the completion link from previous years.

Harisree CL

entry.title: Re: "You cannot delete this question because it is associ...
entry.content:
Hi @user116 

Why the error happens

In the LMS database:
When a learner takes an exam/quiz, the system records their answers at the time of attempt, linked to the question ID.
That creates user data referencing the question.
Deleting that question would break the historical record.
As a result, the system blocks deletion and forces you to preserve the record for audit purposes.

What You Can Do
You cannot delete a question that’s tied to historical completions — this is by design for audit/compliance.
You can:
Retire / deactivate the question (so it’s not used in future tests).
Edit the libraries and assessments so this question is removed from all active exams going forward.
Optionally, create a new question if you need a replacement — with a new ID.

How to Identify Where It’s Used (Direct Test Association)

To find where the question is currently used:
Learning Administration → Question Library
Open the specific question.
There should be a section/tab showing Associated Exams/Assessments (depending on your version, sometimes called "Active Exams" or "Used By").
Note the Exam IDs listed — these are the assessments that contain this question.

Harisree CL

entry.title: Re: Successfactors LMS : Overdue learning notification
entry.content:
Hi @Divya

it’s possible that these reminder notifications are coming from a different SAP SuccessFactors Learning environment (such as TEST, STG, or DEV) if that system:


Has Email Notifications enabled
Contains a copy of your production data from a recent refresh
Still has the job scheduler running for the notification templates


This can happen more often than you’d think — especially right after a refresh from PROD to TEST/DEV — because:
Your TEST/DEV environment will now contain real email addresses from PROD.
Scheduled jobs, including Item Required Soon, Item Past Due, Curriculum Required Soon, etc., may still be active.
Unless email sending is disabled, those systems can send “fake” or outdated reminders to actual users.

Harisree CL

entry.title: Re: In sap tm, for Freight Unit automatic creation can we generate multiple FUs with different quant
entry.content: You can achieve this using the process controller framework. Define a custom strategy after FUB_AUTO to split the freight unit into multiple FUs with different quantities. A BAdI enhancement is required to implement the split logic.

entry.title: Building Enterprise Ready Data Products with SAP Business Data Cloud
entry.content:
If you've been working with SAP data for a while, you know the struggle. Business users ask for "simple" customer sales reports, and you end up writing complex queries joining 15+ tables (KNA1, KNB1, KNAS, VBAK, VBAP, VBUP... the list goes on). Each developer creates their own version, data definitions become inconsistent, and maintenance becomes a nightmare.

SAP Business Data Cloud introduces Data Products, managed and governed datasets that preserve SAP business context. They give business users clear, reusable data instead of one-off SQL and keep analytics consistent across teams. BDC unifies SAP Datasphere, SAP Analytics Cloud, BW modernization, and SAP Databricks in one SaaS platform.In practice, you model in SAP Datasphere, then package and publish as a data product using the Data Sharing Cockpit. Consumers discover and install products from a central catalog

Purpose of Data Products

1. Efficient Data Sharing Across Domains: Data Products facilitate replication-free integration and consumption by SAP, customer, and partner applications via APIs and Events.

2. Efficient Data Storage: Data Products are processed and curated in a modern object-store-based data lake architecture with highly scalable Spark processing.

3. High-Quality Metadata: Metadata includes business semantics and is accessible through directories like the Data Product Directory and ORD Aggregators, enhancing discoverability.

4. Optimized for Analytics:Data sets are curated for intensive reads and consumed in a read-only fashion, ensuring efficiency and reliability.

5. Supporting Analytical and AI Applications: Data Products provide foundational data for dashboards, analytical models, and AI applications.

6. Decentralized Ownership: Inspired by Data Mesh principles, Data Products are owned and managed by domain experts or teams responsible for operational data.

7. Lifecycle Management: Data Products undergo needs analysis, design, and delivery phases, ensuring their accuracy and relevance.

Integration and Consumption

Data Products are exposed for consumption via APIs, Events, or Delta Sharing protocols. They are described using Open Resource Discovery (ORD) metadata, which includes attributes such as visibility, release status, and integration dependencies.

Components of Data Products

1. Data Aspect:

  • Includes business objects, analytical data, graph data, and spatial data.
  • Optimized for intensive reads and consumed in a read-only fashion.

2. API Aspect:

  • APIs are described with metadata for machine and human-readable documentation.
  • Supports protocols like Delta Sharing and CSN Interop.

3. Metadata Aspect:

  • ORD Aggregators collect metadata for discoverability.
  • Includes attributes like visibility, integration dependencies, and output ports.

4. Product Aspect:

  • Managed with a product mindset, focusing on consumer needs.
  • Includes defined owners responsible for lifecycle and quality.

5. Business Semantic Aspect:

  • Describes semantic models using Entity Types, bridging conceptual and technical data models.

Architecture of Data Products

Data Sharing View

This diagram illustrates how data is shared between providers and recipients using the Delta Sharing protocol. The Data Provider manages data lake tables and access permissions, which are exposed through a Delta Sharing Server.

 

Discovery and Generation Workflow

This diagram shows how data product definitions are discovered and generated. Source Lines of Business (LoB) provide data product definitions, which are read and listed by the SAP Business Data Cloud catalog. These definitions are then used to generate data lake tables, making data products available for consumption.

 

Consumption Workflow

This diagram illustrates how consumers discover, integrate, and access data products.

 

Types of Data Products

SAP-managed vs customer-managed Data Products:

  • Starting with SAP S/4HANA Cloud, SAP is providing a comprehensive set of SAP-managed data products across the Lines of Business (LoB). Customer only need to activate these predefined data products and then SAP takes care for extraction, loading and data curation.
  • Customer also can create their own customer-managed data products to enhance the set of data products with data from any SAP or non-SAP application. Customer-managed data products are curated in SAP Datasphere. The data and ORD file(s) are stored in the customer-managed object store within SAP Datasphere.
  • Both type of data products are technically identical. They are stored in an object store, described via ORD file and published in the SAP BDC data catalogue.

 

Steps to create a SAP S/4HANA Customer Managed Data Product.

1. Identify, create, or extend a CDS entity: To build a customer-managed data product in an SAP S/4HANA system, the recommended approach is to leverage CDS views/entities. In this example, we’ll create a custom CDS entity as shown below.

Note: As a best practice, customers should leverage SAP-released CDS views first, extend them where needed, and only create custom CDS views when business requirements demand it. This is fully permissible under the clean core paradigm, as business requirements ultimately take priority.

@ObjectModel.usageType.dataClass: #TRANSACTIONAL
@ObjectModel.usageType.serviceQuality: #A
@ObjectModel.usageType.sizeCategory: #XL
@ObjectModel.representativeKey: 'CampaignID'
@ObjectModel.modelingPattern:         #ANALYTICAL_DIMENSION
@ObjectModel.supportedCapabilities: [ #ANALYTICAL_DIMENSION,
                                      #CDS_MODELING_DATA_SOURCE,
                                      #CDS_MODELING_ASSOCIATION_TARGET,
                                      #SQL_DATA_SOURCE,
                                      #EXTRACTION_DATA_SOURCE ]

@ObjectModel.sapObjectNodeType.name: 'CampaignID'
@EndUserText.label: 'CDS View for Campaigning Data'
@Analytics.dataCategory: #DIMENSION
@Analytics.internalName: #LOCAL
@Analytics: {
    dataExtraction: {
        enabled: true,
        delta.changeDataCapture: {
            mapping:[
                {
                    table: 'zcampaign', role: #MAIN,
                    viewElement: ['CampaignID'],
                    tableElement: ['campaign_id']
                }
            ]
        }
    }
 }

@VDM.viewType: #BASIC
@Metadata.allowExtensions: true
@Metadata.ignorePropagatedAnnotations: true

define view entity ZCDS_campaign as select from zcampaign
{
 @EndUserText.label: 'Campaign_ID'
    key zcampaign.campaign_id as CampaignId,
    @EndUserText.label: 'Campaign_Name'
    zcampaign.campaign_name as CampaignName,
     @EndUserText.label: 'Channel'
    zcampaign.channel as Channel,
    zcampaign.type as Type,
    zcampaign.start_date as StartDate,
    zcampaign.end_date as EndDate,
    zcampaign.status as Status,
     @Semantics.amount.currencyCode: 'BudgetCurrency'
    zcampaign.budget as Budget,
    zcampaign.budget_currency as BudgetCurrency,
     @Semantics.amount.currencyCode: 'ActualSpendCurrency'
    zcampaign.actual_spend as ActualSpend,
    zcampaign.actual_spend_currency as ActualSpendCurrency,
    zcampaign.created_by as CreatedBy,
    zcampaign.created_on as CreatedOn
    
}

2. SAP S/4HANA Private Cloud or On-Premise Edition requires a Cloud Connector: Configure the Cloud Connector to enable communication between your on-premise/private cloud system and SAP Datasphere (public cloud). This setup is a prerequisite for creating an SAP S/4HANA or ABAP connection in SAP Datasphere for using the replication flow feature.

3. Create a Datasphere Space of Type HANA Data Lake Files:  An administrator can create a space backed by SAP HANA Data Lake Files in the object store. File spaces are designed for cost-efficient staging, loading, and preparing large volumes of data.

Key Attributes of Data Products

Attribute Description

TypeDefines the type (primary, derived).
CategoryCategorizes the data set (e.g., business-object, analytical).
VisibilitySpecifies exposure (public, internal, private).
Input PortsIntegration dependencies describing data inputs for lineage purposes.
Output PortsAPIs or Events through which the data can be accessed.
Integration DependenciesRelationships with external resources.
ResponsibleOrganization/team responsible for lifecycle management.

What makes a Data Product different

A data product is more than a view. It is a packaged, documented, read-optimized asset with ownership, licensing, and usage controls. You select which artifacts to expose, set visibility, and publish for others to install and reuse. This replaces scattered SQL with a standardized way to deliver analytics. SAP Help Portal

Traditional, ad-hoc SQL

SELECT k.kunnr, k.name1, v.vbeln, v.netwr
FROM kna1 k
JOIN vbak v ON k.kunnr = v.kunnr
WHERE k.land1 = 'US' AND v.erdat >= '2024-01-01';

 Productized, after install in your space
You install the product from the Catalog. It exposes governed artifacts, for example an Analytic Model with measures, dimensions, and time logic ready to query.

SELECT
  CUSTOMER_NAME,
  ORDER_YEAR,
  TOTAL_SALES_VALUE,
  NUMBER_OF_ORDERS
FROM ZH_CUSTOMER_SALES_PERF   -- artifact delivered by the installed product
WHERE COUNTRY = 'United States' AND ORDER_YEAR = 2024;

Common pitfalls and how to avoid them

  • No owner
    Always assign a named team and escalation path.

  • Hidden breaking changes
    Use versions and release notes.

  • Underspecified semantics
    Add definitions for measures, currencies, time, and keys.

  • Treating products like tables
    Ship contracts, not columns. Consumers need stability.

  • Over-engineering day one
    Start with a narrow scope. Expand by demand

Wrap up

Data Products move SAP analytics from projects to products. They carry context, ownership, and contracts. Teams discover, install, and use them with confidence. You spend less time debugging joins and more time creating value.

entry.title: Staging of components from an external warehouse to an EWM warehouse
entry.content:
Hello SAP Gurus, 

In our business case, we have 2 Storage Locations under our plant. Lets call them A and B.

SLOC A is EWM managed. This is where all the production takes place. We have PSAs defined under this EWM warehouse. 

SLOC B is physically situated appx. 10 kms away. This SLOC is declared as a Decentralized Warehouse, run and managed by a 3rd party service provider. 

We have Production Orders, with some components that are stored in SLOC A (EWM warehouse), and some in SLOC B (Dec. warehouse).  The ones that are stored in SLOC B, needs to be moved from this dec. whse. to the PSAs. 

Most of the threads I have come across related to this situation suggests creation of STOs from SLOC B to A. But, is there an SAP standard functionality that can help us create such STOs automatically? Ideally, there should be a way to: 

1. Initiate staging of the components that are stored in the EWM whse to the PSAs, and simultaneously,

2. Automatic creation of the STOs of the components that are stored in the dec. whse. 

Is it somehow possible in SAP std? 

What makes the situation more tricky is that some components can sometimes be stored at both the locations. In that case, if enough stock is available at the EWM warehouse, system should not create the STOs, rather the SAP EWM staging requests. 

Are there any suggestions around this? Thanks for the pointers and leads in advance! 

Regards

Rahul Sharma

entry.title: Hire and Onboard Talent Faster - Join us at Success Connect in Las Vegas & Virtually!
entry.content:
Success Connect at SAP Connect is coming up from October 6-8, 2025 in Las Vegas and virtually! We are excited this year to have a track all around Talent Acquisition. Take a look at the agenda builder for sessions on SAP SuccessFactors Recruiting, SAP SuccessFactors Onboarding, SmartRecruiters, and solutions from our partners on how to Hire and Onboard Talent Faster with AI, Skills Matching, and Automation! 

 

The Hire and Onboard Talent Faster with AI, Skills Matching and Automation track will highlight innovative solutions and intelligent hiring strategies that organizations can use to attract top talent, including sessions like: 

1. Roadmap & Strategy Sessions

Learn about the latest product strategy, vision, and roadmap for SAP SuccessFactors and SmartRecruiters!  Discover AI-driven capabilities, enhanced candidate and recruiter experiences, and innovative talent strategies to hire and onboard the best talent. Explore new AI innovations that offer flexibility, automation, and insights available across the entire talent journey. 

2. Deep Dives, Demos, Product Tours & Quick Tips

Gain a deeper understanding of SAP SuccessFactors, SmartRecruiters, and partner solutions in action with detailed sessions and live Q&A. Engage with product experts at our demo booth, or schedule a 1:1 dedicated session to meet with experts to address your questions on product features, integrations, and technology. 

3. Customer Success Stories

Hear directly from people leaders across industries as they share their experiences, business drivers, and lessons learned . Discover how leading organizations are achieving faster hiring, better workforce alignment, and measurable business outcomes.  

4. Workshops, Roundtables, Hands-on Labs, Training 

Engage in interactive discussions with peers, experts, and industry leaders to exchange ideas, solve hiring challenges, and walk away with actionable insights. Explore how SAP SuccessFactors and SmartRecruiters can support skills-based hiring strategies, enable smarter decision making, and streamline talent processes. Learn best practices from real-world experiences, discover emerging trends, and collaborate on strategies that your can begin leveraging in your hiring processes. 

5. Networking & Expert Insights 

From peer roundtables to Ask the Experts sessions, you'll have multiple opportunities to connect, collaborate, and be inspired. Network with talent acquisition leaders, engage directly with SAP and SmartRecruiters experts, and make valuable connections that extend far beyond the conference. 

Don't miss your chance to experience Success Connect at SAP Connect 2025 in Las Vegas - or join virtually from anywhere. Review the agenda builder today and plan your journey to transform the way you hire and onboard the best talent. 

See you in Las Vegas!

entry.title: Re: How to count distinct numbers from a internal table using SAP ABAP 7.5 ?
entry.content:
7.5: 7.5x or 7.50?

With 7.52 and HANA database:

select COMP, COUNT( distinct ID1 ) as count_distinct_id1, COUNT( distinct ID2 ) as count_distinct_id2
       from @itab_source_data
       group by count
       into table @DATA(itab_result).

entry.title: Re: How to count distinct numbers from a internal table u...
entry.content:
Tried two different approaches: one using  SELECT on an internal table with grouping and count, and another using  FOR GROUPS.
When I used SELECT on an internal table, I received a warning: The SELECT command is executed on the database. Reason for this warning,

  • If it is known statically that the statement cannot be processed by the ABAP SQL engine and if no database tables are accessed in the statement. 
  • An internal table as a data source of SELECT can be a potential alternative to the statements READ TABLE and LOOP AT in order to exploit ABAP SQL syntax possible that is not possible with the statements for internal tables.
  • The use of SELECT to access an internal table is usually less efficient than the statements for internal tables and should only be used in cases not covered by these statements.
  • Source https://help.sap.com/doc/abapdocu_758_index_htm/7.58/en-US/abapselect_itab.htm 

Because of this, I explored the alternative with FOR GROUPS and I was able to achieve the same result. Additionally, LOOP AT GROUP can also be used for this requirement.

Here’s the snippet

TYPES: BEGIN OF ty_data,
         company_code TYPE bukrs,
         id1          TYPE text100,
         id2          TYPE text100,
       END OF ty_data,

       BEGIN OF ty_count,
         company_code TYPE bukrs,
         id1          TYPE int4,
         id2          TYPE int4,
       END OF ty_count,

       tt_data  TYPE TABLE OF ty_data WITH EMPTY KEY,
       tt_count TYPE TABLE OF ty_count WITH EMPTY KEY.

DATA(lt_count) = VALUE tt_count( ).
DATA(lt_data) = VALUE tt_data( ( company_code = '1000' id1 = 'A1' id2 = 'B1' )
                               ( company_code = '1000' id1 = 'A1' id2 = 'B2' )
                               ( company_code = '1000' id1 = 'A2' id2 = 'B1' )
                               ( company_code = '1000' id1 = 'A3' id2 = 'B2' )
                               ( company_code = '2000' id1 = 'A1' id2 = 'B1' )
                               ( company_code = '2000' id1 = 'A2' id2 = 'B1' )  ).

"Way 1
SELECT company_code,
       COUNT( DISTINCT id1 ) AS id1,
       COUNT( DISTINCT id2 ) AS id2
       FROM @LT_data AS lt_data
       GROUP BY company_code
       INTO TABLE @LT_count.

"Way 2
lt_count = VALUE #( FOR GROUPS members OF lw IN lt_data
                    GROUP BY ( company_code = lw-company_code ) (
                    company_code = members-company_code
                    id1 = lines( REDUCE #( INIT lt_unique TYPE tt_data
                                           FOR member IN GROUP members
                                           NEXT lt_unique = COND #( WHEN NOT line_exists( lt_unique[ id1 = member-id1 ] )
                                                                    THEN VALUE #( BASE lt_unique ( id1 = member-id1 ) )
                                                                    ELSE lt_unique ) ) )
                    id2 = lines( REDUCE #( INIT lt_unique TYPE tt_data
                                           FOR member IN GROUP members
                                           NEXT lt_unique = COND #( WHEN NOT line_exists( lt_unique[ id2 = member-id2 ] )
                                                                    THEN VALUE #( BASE lt_unique ( id2 = member-id2 ) )
                                                                    ELSE lt_unique ) ) ) ) ).

Hope this will help.

entry.title: Charm is utility of which system
Gstin Validation while creating customer in BP transaction using OData service.
entry.content:
Hey SAP folks,

I am working on a validation scenario in the BP transaction. Specifically, when creating a Customer via the OData service, I want to ensure that the GSTIN provided in the payload does not already exist in the system. Only if the GSTIN is unique should the customer be created.

I have explored several BADIs such as:

  • ADDRESS_CHECK

  • ADDR_TXJCD_CHECK

  • BUPA_FURTHER_CHECKS

  • BUPA_ADDR_CHECKBP, validation

However, I could not find the GSTIN field in any of the available structures or tables within these BADIs.

This is the part of sample payload.
"to_BusinessPartnerTax": {
    "results": [
      {
        "BusinessPartner": "10",
        "BPTaxType": "IN3",
        "BPTaxNumber": "27XXXXXXIE1XX"
       }
    ]
However i found the GSTIN in stack call but it is declare as a local variable so i am unable to access these.

Could you please guide me on how to implement this validation?


Thanks in advance.

entry.title: Gstin Validation while creating customer in BP transaction using OData service.
entry.content:
Hey SAP folks,

I am working on a validation scenario in the BP transaction. Specifically, when creating a Customer via the OData service, I want to ensure that the GSTIN provided in the payload does not already exist in the system. Only if the GSTIN is unique should the customer be created.

I have explored several BADIs such as:

ADDRESS_CHECK

ADDR_TXJCD_CHECK

BUPA_FURTHER_CHECKS

BUPA_ADDR_CHECKBP, validation

However, I could not find the GSTIN field in any of the available structures or tables within these BADIs.

This is the part of sample payload.
"to_BusinessPartnerTax": {
"results": [
{
"BusinessPartner": "10",
"BPTaxType": "IN3",
"BPTaxNumber": "27XXXXXXIE1XX"
}
]
However i found the GSTIN in stack call but it is declare as a local variable so i am unable to access these.

Could you please guide me on how to implement this validation?


Thanks in advance.

Regards

SS

entry.title: Re: provisioning users to SAC directly from Entra ID
entry.content:
It is a prerequisite to have a user profile in IAS to be able to use story report.
Furthermore, Story authentication uses PerPerson UUID field from SF as Custom attribute 1 in IAS and username in SAC
If it is missing, the user will not be able to use story report

entry.title: Re: How to resolve the error print character not assigned...
entry.content:
Go to Sales and Distribution > Billing > Billing Documents > Country/Region-Specific Features > Country-specific Features for Portugal > Digital Signature. Here check all the required parameters are maintained correctly.

That means, your resolution approach would be

  • Start with number range assignment and SAF‑T mapping
  • Then check whether your company code/sales org is enabled for digital signature.
  • Once these are correct, new billing documents will get a print character.
  • For existing documents without a print character, you may need to re‑run the signature program (e.g., RPFIESPT or equivalent in your release).

entry.title: Re: Story Report - Individual View by Employee
entry.content:
Data in story report is shown as per the users permission (union of all assigned permission),
If a user has access to data other than self , it will be visible in the report

As of now , no self scope is available,  please see 3203794 - Is reporting only on self data possible in Story report? [People Analytics] - SAP for Me

entry.title: Re: Add custom order by coumns in Story report
entry.content: You can refer to 3333000 - Sorting Dimension values used as columns in a Cross-tab widget in Story Report - SAP for Me

entry.title: Re: All the partners are not copied into billing document...
entry.content:
Why you see like that is because,

  • in the public cloud edition, the system is optimized to avoid redundant partner entries.
  • if a partner function at billing item level is identical to the one already maintained at billing header level, the system does not duplicate it at item level in the Manage Billing Document app. That’s why you see only the “unique” partners at item level in the Fiori app.
  • In the GUI display, however, the technical partner determination logic still shows the full set (header + item), which is why you see all 10 there.

In public cloud, partner determination and copy control are pre-delivered and restricted compared to on‑premise/private cloud. There is no configuration option to force all header‑level partners to also appear redundantly at item level in the Manage Billing Document app. The system design is intentional: it reduces data duplication and simplifies partner handling in billing.

entry.title: Re: Integrated Financial Planning CAPEX Delta Planning Da...
entry.content:
Hi SANA11,

this is due to rounding effects. Depreciation percentage is 12% per year, i.e. 1% per month.

March: 4000 * 12%/12 = 40

April: (4000 - 40) *  12%/12 = 39,6

May: (4000 - 40 - 39,6) * 12%/12 = 39,2

etc.

entry.title: Re: [Q]311 Transfer Best Practice: Don’t Mix MIGO with /S...
entry.content:
Right now, your paragraph explains the technical details well, but the main principle is a little buried among them. By re‑phrasing so that this principle jumps out immediately, and the supporting details follow.

For a 311 same‑plant storage‑location transfer, always follow a single‑point posting principle: either post the 311 in IM (MIGO/Fiori) and stop there, or initiate it in EWM (posting change/warehouse task) and let the system back‑post IM automatically. Do not repeat the step in /SCWM/PRDI or /SCWM/PRDO, since 311 is not delivery‑based and has no PGI/GR chain. Mixing MIGO with PRDI/PRDO causes duplicate postings, queue errors, and IM–EWM mismatches. Only delivery‑based processes (e.g., STOs or inter‑plant transfers) should use PRDO → PGI and PRDI → GR, and in those cases you should not use 311.

entry.title: Re: Staging of components from an external warehouse to a...
entry.content: Standard SAP's recommendation is use MRP + special procurement key to automatically create STOs from SLOC B to A. Then let EWM handle staging from A to PSA. For materials stored in both A and B, configure sourcing rules so MRP prefers A if stock is available, and only pulls from B when A is short.

entry.title: Re: Add a new payment block other than (R) for Invoice bl...
entry.content:
• OB27 only defines new block codes; it does not control the automatic assignment.
  • “R” is the SAP default for invoice verification blocks.
  • To use your own code automatically, you need either:
    • A workflow substitution (practical, no coding), or
    • A BAdI/user exit (technical, replaces “R” at posting).

entry.title: Re: Profit center Difference in Round off Difference G/L...
entry.content:
The reason why you see two profit centers is because, when you post an incoming payment in F‑28, the system clears the customer line and posts any rounding difference to the rounding difference G/L account. The customer line item inherits its profit center from the original invoice (via document splitting). The rounding difference line needs a cost object (cost center) to derive a profit center. If the system cannot derive it from document splitting, it falls back to default account assignment (OKB9 or cost element master). That’s why you see two different profit centers, one from the invoice/customer line and the other from the default assignment for the rounding difference.

The OKB9 settings is not working in your case is because in OKB9 you assign a cost center to a cost element G/L account. But if the G/L account is not a cost element, OKB9 won’t be called. If the G/L account already has a default cost center in FS00/KA01, that overrides OKB9. If document splitting is active, the system may try to derive the profit center differently, and OKB9 is ignored.

So in order to fix your issue, ensure the rounding difference G/L Account is created as a cost element. Remove any default cost center in FS00/KA01 if you want OKB9 to control it. Assign the rounding difference G/L account to a cost center in OKB9. If you want profit center derivation, ensure the cost center in OKB9 is linked to the correct profit center in its master data.

Finally and importantly, if you want the rounding difference to follow the same profit center as the customer line, you may need to adjust document splitting rules so that the rounding difference inherits the profit center from the clearing item. Otherwise, it will always post to the default profit center from OKB9.

entry.title: Re: Not Assigned functional area COGS Account for semi fi...
entry.content:
Your one line statement is not enough to understand the issue. When you create a post and expecting assistance here, please share as much information as possible.

Now coming to the issue, the missing functional area is usually due to master data gaps (G/L, cost element, cost center) or config gaps (splitting, substitution). To resolve, need to know the posting scenario and account type. Please answer the following:

  • Which transaction created these G/L entries (FB50, MIRO, F‑28, etc.)?
  • Which G/L accounts are affected (P&L or balance sheet)?
  • Is document splitting active in their system?
  • Is the functional area maintained in the G/L master data (FS00)?
  • Are they expecting functional area from a cost center, order, or WBS?
  • Is this issue happening for all postings or only specific scenarios?
  • Do they have any substitution rules for functional area in OBBH?

entry.title: Re: Required separate Accounting Document Type For Credit...
entry.content:
Yes, in Public Cloud, the billing document type RV is hard‑coded to post into accounting with a single FI document type. You cannot directly create new accounting document types for Credit Memo and Debit Memo postings.

You have two workarounds to meet the requirement.

  • In some local versions for countries like India, Italy, Venezuela, SAP has delivered functionality to assign different FI document types to billing types due to legal compliance (ODN – Official Document Numbering). This is not available globally, only in countries where SAP has identified a legal requirement. If you have this option, try it.
  • The other option is CPF framework for Flexible Billing Document Posting, which SAP has introduced. With CPF, you can define rules (formulas) that determine the FI document type dynamically based on billing type (e.g., F2 = Invoice, G2 = Credit Memo, L2 = Debit Memo). This requires configuration in Custom Adaptations for Integration of Billing with Financial Accounting SSCUIs

entry.title: Re: Implementation of a taxable entity across system boundaries (public cloud ↔ private cloud) using
entry.content:
Hi Janina,

SAP DRC sources its data from the ERP. Thus, all data needs to reside within the same ERP. If you are looking to consolidate data from different company codes sourced from independent SAP instances into one reporting entity this is not officially supported. For an automated process you will have to build a workaround that consolidates the business data into one ERP. This is complicated, but we have done something like this in the past in my team.

Kind regards,

Ferhat Tuncer
